column4: Can someone give me a link to a guide for ATI drivers installation?
hey guys let me get this straight, in Ubuntu the main way to install programs is by downloading them from the "add\Remove" window again and again every time i reinstall windows or something?
as far as i undarstand, the main way to install software in ubuntu is by usong the Add/Remove application
but what if i want to install some application that is not on the list?
there are only a limited amount of packages listed in Add/Remove. Synaptic will list all avsailable packages
ah so if lets say... i want a video editing software, i must go to synapics and search for video editing software?
i am currently downloading Wine, its a large file, if tommorow i will reinstall Ubuntu, where can i find this file on my HD to reinstall it?
or at least how can i back it up so that i wont have to redownload it
how can i back up Wine on a saparate partition?
plus /var/apt/cach doest work, it says "no such file or directory"
